com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.util.cglib

Class Proxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.util.cglib.Proxy

  • public final class Proxy
extends Object
    Provides static methods for creating dynamic proxy instances by using CGLib framework. The class intended to look and feel similar to Proxy, but this is only a shallow similarity. Unlike Proxy this class is not a superclass of all dynamic proxy classes created by CGLib.

    Simple example:

     interface MyInterface {
        Integer getMaxInteger();
 }
 
 class MyMethodInterceptor implements MethodInterceptor {
        public Object intercept(Object enhancedObject, Method method, Object[] methodArgs,
                        MethodProxy methodProxy) throws Throwable {
                if (method.getName().equals("getMaxInteger")) {
                        return Integer.MAX_VALUE;
                } else if (method.getName().equals("toString")) {
                        return "some CGLib-proxy instance";
                } else {
                        return methodProxy.invokeSuper(enhancedObject, methodArgs);
                }
        }
 }
 
 ...
 MyInterface proxy = Proxy.newProxyInstance(Object.class, new Class<?>[] {MyInterface.class},
                new MyMethodInterceptor(), null, null);
 proxy.toString();// return "some CGLib-proxy instance"
 proxy.getMaxInteger();// return Integer.MAX_VALUE
    Instantiability: forbidden.
    Thread safety: thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> T newProxyInstance(Class<?> superclass, Class<?>[] interfaces, Callback callback, Class<?>[] constructorArgTypes, Object[] constructorArgs)
      Generates a proxy class that extends provided superclass and implements interfaces and creates an instance of generated class by using provided constructor arguments.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newProxyInstance

        public static final <T> T newProxyInstance(Class<?> superclass,
                                           @Nullable
                                           Class<?>[] interfaces,
                                           Callback callback,
                                           @Nullable
                                           Class<?>[] constructorArgTypes,
                                           @Nullable
                                           Object[] constructorArgs)
        Generates a proxy class that extends provided superclass and implements interfaces and creates an instance of generated class by using provided constructor arguments. Provided callback will be used for every invocation of any non-final and non-private method inherited from superclass and interfaces.

        Note that if required proxy class was already generated, it will be reused (see AbstractClassGenerator.setUseCache(boolean) method).

        Type Parameters:
        T - A type/supertype of superclass or type/supertype of any interface in interfaces. The returned object can be explicitly cast to any type that is allowed to be used as T.
        Parameters:
        superclass - A class which the generated class will extend. Must be not null and must have accessible constructor suitable for provided constructorArgTypes and constructorArgs.
        interfaces - Interfaces to implement. Can be null or empty. Factory interface will always be implemented regardless of what is specified here.
        callback - A callback to use in the generated proxy class. Must be not null.
        constructorArgTypes - Types of constructor arguments of superclass. Can be null or empty for the no-arguments constructor, must be the same length as constructorArgs.
        constructorArgs - Constructor arguments of superclass. Can be null or empty for the no-arguments constructor, must be the same length as constructorArgType.
        Returns:
        Proxy (enhanced) object. Note that CGLib-proxies are fundamentally different from Java-proxies. While Java-proxies (see Proxy) are actually wrappers that can delegate calls to the original object, CGLib-proxies are self-sufficient objects that can have some additional logic besides the original one. This is why CGLib-proxies sometimes called enhanced objects.
